page.title: 14BEACH AT VEANTROE BAY
page.content: From{Veantroe Bay}on a clear day you can see the islands of Egilsay,Rousay, Wyre,and Eday as well as the tiny seal inhabited islands of Little Green Holm and Muckle Green Holm. When the tide is ebbing you can walk out on the sand for at least quarter of a mile. At the coast there are huge stones and the soil is{red clay.}In the centre of the bay at Ling Holm the coast is eroding and the sea has broken in to form the Ouse. {Seals}can often be seen in this bay.They are very curious and like to watch what is going on.0n a still day in summer they can be heard honking. Some people think the sound is eerie. On the beach are{skeldroes}(Oyster catchers){Sindloos}(Ringed Plovers)and Redshanks.{Scarfies}(Cormorants)dive for fish.
